design_guidelines.md.content:
# Hobotnika OÜ Website Design Guidelines

## Design Approach
**Reference-Based Approach** - Drawing inspiration from professional B2B consultancy websites like HubSpot and Salesforce, adapted for Estonian business culture with unique octopus-themed brand elements.

## Core Design Elements

### A. Color Palette
**Primary Colors:**
- Navy Blue: 214 85% 32% (brand primary)
- Secondary Blue: 217 91% 60% (interactive elements)
- Accent Cyan: 199 89% 64% (highlights and CTAs)
- White: 0 0% 100% (backgrounds)
- Light Gray: 220 13% 91% (subtle backgrounds)
- Dark Gray: 215 25% 27% (text)

### B. Typography
- **Primary Font:** Inter (Google Fonts) - clean, professional sans-serif
- **Headings:** Font weights 600-700, sizes from 2.5rem (h1) to 1.125rem (h6)
- **Body Text:** Font weight 400, 1rem base size with 1.6 line height
- **Accent Text:** Font weight 500 for emphasis

### C. Layout System
**Spacing Units:** Consistent use of Tailwind units 4, 8, 12, and 16 for margins, padding, and gaps. Sections use py-16 or py-20 for vertical spacing.

### D. Component Library

**Navigation:**
- Fixed header with subtle shadow
- Logo placeholder on left, horizontal menu on right
- Mobile hamburger menu with slide-out drawer
- Navy blue background with white text

**Hero Section:**
- Full viewport height with gradient overlay
- Large typography hierarchy
- Two-column layout: compelling headline left, octopus-inspired visual right
- Primary and secondary CTAs

**Content Sections:**
- Alternating layouts with generous whitespace
- Card-based components with subtle shadows
- Service cards in 3-column grid on desktop
- Testimonial components with client logos

**Forms:**
- Clean, minimal styling with focus states
- Consistent input heights and border radius
- Cyan accent for active states

### E. Estonian Business Professionalism
- Conservative layout structure respecting local business expectations
- Professional imagery and clean aesthetics
- Subtle octopus motifs integrated tastefully without overwhelming corporate credibility
- Estonian language considerations in typography and spacing

## Images
**Hero Background:** Abstract octopus tentacle patterns or geometric interpretations - sophisticated and subtle, not literal cartoon octopus
**Service Icons:** Custom octopus-inspired icons representing adaptability, intelligence, multi-tasking
**About Section:** Professional team photos, Estonian business environment imagery
**Case Studies:** Client work examples, analytics dashboards, growth charts

The website features a **large hero image** as the primary visual anchor, establishing brand identity immediately upon landing.

## Key Principles
1. **Intelligent Adaptability:** Responsive design that works seamlessly across devices
2. **Professional Trust:** Clean layouts with plenty of whitespace
3. **Estonian Heritage:** Subtle nods to local business culture
4. **Octopus Metaphor:** Multi-armed approach to digital marketing solutions
5. **Conversion Focus:** Clear CTAs and logical user journey toward contact

client/src/components/About.tsx.content:
import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Brain, Users, Target, Award } from "lucide-react"; const features = [ { icon: Brain, title: "Strategic Expertise", description: "We provide strategic guidance and business intelligence to help organizations navigate complex challenges and opportunities." }, { icon: Users, title: "Global Experience", description: "Deep understanding of international business environments and market dynamics across diverse industries and regions." }, { icon: Target, title: "Integrated Approach", description: "Comprehensive consulting methodology that addresses strategic, operational, and organizational aspects of business performance." }, { icon: Award, title: "Proven Results", description: "Track record of helping organizations achieve measurable improvements in performance, efficiency, and market position." } ]; export default function About() { return (

About Hobotnika

We are a professional consulting firm helping businesses optimize operations and achieve growth objectives worldwide through strategic guidance and proven methodologies.

{features.map((feature, index) => (
{feature.title}

{feature.description}

 ))}

Why Choose Hobotnika?

Business Expertise: We understand complex business challenges and strategic requirements

Adaptable Strategies: Flexible business strategies that evolve and grow with your organization

Clear Communication: Transparent reporting and comprehensive project management throughout engagements

Results-Driven: Focus on measurable business outcomes that enhance organizational performance

Our Mission

To empower businesses worldwide with strategic guidance and business solutions that enhance operational effectiveness and drive sustainable growth.

Our Vision

To be the world's most trusted business consulting firm, known for our strategic expertise and unwavering commitment to client success.

); }

client/src/components/ui/checkbox.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as CheckboxPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-checkbox"
import { Check } from "lucide-react"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Checkbox = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <CheckboxPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "peer h-4 w-4 shrink-0 rounded-sm border border-primary ring-offset-background focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 data-[state=checked]:bg-primary data-[state=checked]:text-primary-foreground",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator
      className={cn("flex items-center justify-center text-current")}
    >
      <Check className="h-4 w-4" />
    </CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator>
  </CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
))
Checkbox.displayName = CheckboxPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Checkbox }

)) NavigationMenuViewport.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Viewport.displayName const NavigationMenuIndicator = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) NavigationMenuIndicator.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Indicator.displayName export { navigationMenuTriggerStyle, NavigationMenu, NavigationMenuList, NavigationMenuItem, NavigationMenuContent, NavigationMenuTrigger, NavigationMenuLink, NavigationMenuIndicator, NavigationMenuViewport, }

client/src/components/ui/progress.tsx.content:
"use client"

import * as React from "react"
import * as ProgressPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-progress"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Progress = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, value, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ProgressPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative h-4 w-full overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ProgressPrimitive.Indicator
      className="h-full w-full flex-1 bg-primary transition-all"
      style={{ transform: `translateX(-${100 - (value || 0)}%)` }}
    />
  </ProgressPrimitive.Root>
))
Progress.displayName = ProgressPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Progress }

client/src/components/ui/scroll-area.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as ScrollAreaPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-scroll-area"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const ScrollArea = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn("relative overflow-hidden", className)}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport className="h-full w-full rounded-[inherit]">
      {children}
    </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport>
    <ScrollBar />
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Corner />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
))
ScrollArea.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root.displayName

const ScrollBar = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
>(({ className, orientation = "vertical", ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar
    ref={ref}
    orientation={orientation}
    className={cn(
      "flex touch-none select-none transition-colors",
      orientation === "vertical" &&
        "h-full w-2.5 border-l border-l-transparent p-[1px]",
      orientation === "horizontal" &&
        "h-2.5 flex-col border-t border-t-transparent p-[1px]",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaThumb className="relative flex-1 rounded-full bg-border" />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
))
ScrollBar.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar.displayName

export { ScrollArea, ScrollBar }

import * as React from "react"
import * as SliderPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-slider"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Slider = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <SliderPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative flex w-full touch-none select-none items-center",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <SliderPrimitive.Track className="relative h-2 w-full grow overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary">
      <SliderPrimitive.Range className="absolute h-full bg-primary" />
    </SliderPrimitive.Track>
    <SliderPrimitive.Thumb className="block h-5 w-5 rounded-full border-2 border-primary bg-background ring-offset-background transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50" />
  </SliderPrimitive.Root>
))
Slider.displayName = SliderPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Slider }

replit.md.content:
# Hobotnika OÜ Website

## Overview

Hobotnika OÜ is a digital marketing consultancy website built as a React-based single-page application. The project showcases a professional B2B marketing consultancy targeting global business clients. The website features modern design principles with a focus on conversions and user engagement through clean layouts, professional typography, and strategic call-to-action placement.

## User Preferences

Preferred communication style: Simple, everyday language.

## System Architecture

### Frontend Architecture
- **Framework**: React 18 with TypeScript for type safety and modern development practices
- **Routing**: Wouter for lightweight client-side routing with support for Home, About, Services, and Contact pages
- **State Management**: TanStack Query (React Query) for server state management and caching
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with a custom design system based on shadcn/ui components
- **Build Tool**: Vite for fast development and optimized production builds

### Backend Architecture
- **Runtime**: Node.js with Express.js framework
- **Language**: TypeScript throughout the entire stack for consistency
- **API Structure**: RESTful API design with Express routes (currently minimal implementation)
- **Storage Layer**: Abstract storage interface with in-memory implementation (MemStorage class)
- **Development**: Hot module replacement and error overlay for enhanced developer experience

### Database Schema
- **ORM**: Drizzle ORM for type-safe database operations
- **Database**: PostgreSQL (configured via Neon serverless)
- **Schema**: Basic user management with username/password authentication structure
- **Migrations**: Drizzle Kit for database schema management and migrations

### Design System
- **Component Library**: Comprehensive shadcn/ui component system with custom theming
- **Color Palette**: Navy blue primary (#214585), secondary blue (#2563eb), accent cyan (#06b6d4)
- **Typography**: Inter font family with consistent weight and size hierarchy
- **Layout**: Responsive grid system with mobile-first approach
- **Spacing**: Tailwind's 4-unit spacing system for consistent margins and padding

### User Interface Components
- **Navigation**: Fixed header with mobile-responsive hamburger menu
- **Hero Section**: Full-viewport height with gradient overlay and dual CTAs
- **Content Sections**: Card-based layouts with alternating designs and hover effects
- **Forms**: Clean input styling with focus states and validation support
- **Interactive Elements**: Smooth scrolling, hover elevations, and transition animations

## External Dependencies

### UI and Styling
- **@radix-ui**: Complete set of accessible UI primitives for complex components
- **tailwindcss**: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development
- **class-variance-authority**: Type-safe variant API for component styling
- **lucide-react**: Consistent icon library for UI elements

### State and Data Management
- **@tanstack/react-query**: Server state management with caching and synchronization
- **react-hook-form**: Form handling with validation support
- **@hookform/resolvers**: Form validation resolvers for schema validation

### Database and Backend
- **@neondatabase/serverless**: Serverless PostgreSQL database connection
- **drizzle-orm**: Type-safe ORM for database operations
- **drizzle-zod**: Zod integration for schema validation
- **express**: Web application framework for Node.js

### Development Tools
- **vite**: Fast build tool with hot module replacement
- **typescript**: Static type checking for enhanced development experience
- **@replit/vite-plugin-runtime-error-modal**: Development error handling
- **tsx**: TypeScript execution engine for development server

### Utilities and Enhancements
- **date-fns**: Date manipulation and formatting library
- **clsx**: Conditional className utility for dynamic styling
- **cmdk**: Command palette functionality for improved UX
- **wouter**: Lightweight routing solution for React applications

client/src/pages/CookiesPage.tsx.content:
export default function CookiesPage() { return (

Cookie Policy

HOBOTNIKA OÜ

Effective Date: January 1, 2025

Last Updated: January 1, 2025

This Cookie Policy explains how Hobotnika OÜ ("Hobotnika," "we," "us," or "our") uses cookies and similar technologies on our website www.hobotnika.ee (the "Website"). This policy should be read together with our Privacy Policy.

1. WHAT ARE COOKIES?

Cookies are small text files placed on your device when you visit a website. They help websites remember your preferences, improve your experience, and provide analytics about how the site is used. Similar technologies include pixels, web beacons, and local storage.

2. HOW WE USE COOKIES

We use cookies to:

  • Ensure our website functions properly
  • Remember your preferences and settings
  • Analyze how visitors use our website to improve performance
  • Understand our audience for business development purposes
  • Enable contact forms and consultation requests

3. TYPES OF COOKIES WE USE

3.1 Strictly Necessary Cookies

These cookies are essential for website operation and cannot be disabled.

Cookie Purpose Duration Provider
Session_ID Maintains user session Session Hobotnika
Security_Token CSRF protection Session Hobotnika
Cookie_Consent Records consent preferences 12 months Hobotnika

3.2 Functional Cookies

These cookies remember your choices to provide enhanced features.

Cookie Purpose Duration Provider
Language_Pref Language selection 12 months Hobotnika
Region_Settings Regional preferences 6 months Hobotnika

3.3 Analytics Cookies

These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website for business improvement purposes.

Cookie Purpose Duration Provider
_ga Identifies unique users for analytics 2 years Google Analytics
_ga_[ID] Session tracking for analytics 2 years Google Analytics
_gid Daily user identification 24 hours Google Analytics

4. GOOGLE ANALYTICS USAGE

4.1 Business Analytics Only

We use Google Analytics solely to:

  • Understand website usage patterns
  • Improve our service offerings
  • Analyze consultation request sources
  • Optimize website performance for business purposes

We have configured Google Analytics with:

  • IP anonymization enabled
  • Data retention limited to 14 months
  • Google Signals disabled
  • No data sharing with Google for advertising purposes
  • Demographics and interests reports disabled

4.2 Data Collection Limitations

Google Analytics data is used exclusively for:

  • Internal business analysis
  • Website performance optimization
  • Understanding our consulting market
  • Improving user experience

No advertising or marketing use:

We do not use Google Analytics data for advertising, remarketing, or cross-site tracking purposes.

4.3 Google Consent Mode

For visitors from the EEA and UK, we implement Google Consent Mode which adjusts data collection based on consent status:

  • analytics_storage: Controls storage of analytics-related data
  • ad_storage: Set to "denied" (we do not use advertising features)

5. YOUR CONSENT CHOICES

5.1 Consent Management

When you first visit our website, we ask for your consent before placing non-essential cookies. You can:

  • Accept analytics cookies for website improvement
  • Reject all non-essential cookies
  • Change your preferences at any time

5.2 Managing Your Preferences

You can manage cookie preferences through:

  • Our cookie consent banner
  • Browser settings (see Section 6)
  • Contacting us directly

5.3 Consequences of Refusing Cookies

If you refuse analytics cookies:

  • Strictly necessary cookies will still be used
  • Website functionality remains intact
  • We cannot analyze usage patterns to improve our services
  • All consultation and contact features remain available

6. BROWSER COOKIE CONTROLS

Most browsers allow you to:

  • View what cookies are stored
  • Delete cookies individually or entirely
  • Block third-party cookies
  • Block all cookies
  • Set preferences for specific websites

Browser Instructions:

  • Chrome: chrome://settings/cookies
  • Firefox: about:preferences#privacy
  • Safari: Preferences → Privacy
  • Edge: edge://settings/privacy
  • Opera: opera://settings/privacy

7. OPT-OUT MECHANISMS

Google Analytics Opt-Out:

  • Install the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on
  • Available at: tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout

Browser Privacy Signals:

We honor Global Privacy Control (GPC) signals where legally required

8. BUSINESS PURPOSE CLARIFICATION

8.1 Consulting Business Focus

As a professional consulting firm, we use cookies solely for:

  • Website functionality and security
  • Understanding our business audience
  • Improving our service delivery
  • Analyzing consultation request patterns

8.2 No Advertising Platform Activities

We explicitly do not engage in:

  • Cross-site tracking
  • Behavioral advertising
  • Data sales to third parties
  • Remarketing campaigns
  • Ad network participation

9. INTERNATIONAL COMPLIANCE

9.1 European Users

For EU/EEA users, we comply with:

  • ePrivacy Directive 2002/58/EC
  • General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
  • Estonian Electronic Communications Act

We obtain prior consent for all non-essential cookies.

9.2 Other Jurisdictions

We respect privacy preferences for users in all jurisdictions, applying privacy-by-design principles globally.

10. DATA SECURITY AND RETENTION

10.1 Security Measures

We implement security measures for cookie data:

  • HTTPS encryption for all data transmission
  • Secure and HttpOnly flags where appropriate
  • SameSite attributes to prevent CSRF attacks
  • Regular security audits

10.2 Retention Periods

  • Session cookies: Deleted when browser closes
  • Analytics cookies: Maximum 2 years (with 14-month data retention in Google Analytics)
  • Preference cookies: 12 months maximum

11. THIRD-PARTY SERVICES

11.1 Google Analytics

Google Analytics is our only third-party service that uses cookies. We have configured it strictly for business analytics purposes without advertising features.

11.2 No Other Third-Party Tracking

We do not use:

  • Social media tracking pixels
  • Advertising networks
  • Cross-site tracking services
  • Marketing automation platforms that track users

12. UPDATES TO THIS POLICY

We may update this Cookie Policy to reflect:

  • Changes in our business practices
  • New legal requirements
  • Technology updates

We will notify you of material changes through website notices. The "Last Updated" date shows when this policy was last revised.

13. CONTACT INFORMATION

For questions about our cookie practices:

Data Protection Contact:

Hobotnika OÜ

Email: privacy@hobotnika.com

Address: Narva mnt 5, 10117 Tallinn, Estonia

Phone: +351 933679097

Estonian Supervisory Authority:

Andmekaitse Inspektsioon

Address: Tatari 39, 10134 Tallinn, Estonia

Email: info@aki.ee

Website: www.aki.ee

© 2025 Hobotnika OÜ. All rights reserved.

); }

client/src/pages/GdprPage.tsx.content:
export default function GdprPage() { return (

Data Protection and Privacy

Your Rights Under GDPR

Effective Date: January 1, 2025

Last Updated: January 1, 2025

At Hobotnika OÜ, we are committed to protecting your personal data and respecting your privacy rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and Estonian data protection law. This page explains your rights and how we comply with data protection requirements.

1. OUR COMMITMENT TO DATA PROTECTION

Hobotnika OÜ takes data protection seriously. As an Estonian company serving global clients, we comply with:

  • General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR)
  • Estonian Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA)
  • International data protection standards
  • Industry best practices for data security

We process personal data lawfully, fairly, and transparently, implementing appropriate measures to protect your information throughout its lifecycle.

2. YOUR RIGHTS AS A DATA SUBJECT

Under GDPR, you have comprehensive rights regarding your personal data:

2.1 Right to Access (Article 15)

You can request:

  • Confirmation of whether we process your personal data
  • A copy of your personal data we hold
  • Information about how we process it, including purposes, categories, recipients, retention periods, and your rights

How to exercise: Submit a data access request via email to privacy@hobotnika.com with proof of identity.

Timeline: We respond within 30 days (extendable by 2 months for complex requests).

2.2 Right to Rectification (Article 16)

You can request correction of inaccurate personal data or completion of incomplete data.

How to exercise: Contact us with specific corrections needed and supporting documentation if applicable.

Timeline: Corrections made without undue delay.

2.3 Right to Erasure/"Right to be Forgotten" (Article 17)

You can request deletion of your personal data when:

  • Data is no longer necessary for original purposes
  • You withdraw consent (where consent is the legal basis)
  • You object to processing and no overriding legitimate grounds exist
  • Data was unlawfully processed
  • Legal obligations require erasure

Exceptions: We may retain data for legal claims, compliance obligations, or public interest purposes.

2.4 Right to Restrict Processing (Article 18)

You can request temporary suspension of processing while we:

  • Verify accuracy of contested data
  • Assess legitimate grounds following an objection
  • Establish, exercise, or defend legal claims

2.5 Right to Data Portability (Article 20)

For data processed based on consent or contract, you can:

  • Receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format
  • Request direct transfer to another controller (where technically feasible)

Scope: Applies only to data you provided and automated processing.

2.6 Right to Object (Article 21)

You can object to processing based on:

  • Legitimate interests: We must stop unless we demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds
  • Direct marketing: Absolute right to object - we will stop immediately
  • Statistical/research purposes: Unless necessary for public interest tasks

2.7 Rights Regarding Automated Decision-Making (Article 22)

You have the right not to be subject to decisions based solely on automated processing that significantly affect you.

Our practice: We do not currently use fully automated decision-making for significant decisions. Any profiling for business analysis includes human review.

2.8 Right to Withdraw Consent

Where we rely on consent, you can withdraw it anytime. Withdrawal doesn't affect the lawfulness of prior processing.

How to withdraw: Use our preference center, email privacy@hobotnika.com, or click unsubscribe links in marketing emails.

3. HOW WE PROCESS YOUR DATA

3.1 Legal Bases for Processing

We process personal data only with valid legal basis:

Contract Performance (Article 6(1)(b))

  • Delivering consulting services
  • Managing client relationships
  • Processing payments and invoices
  • Fulfilling contractual obligations

Legitimate Interests (Article 6(1)(f))

  • Business development and marketing to existing clients
  • Network security and fraud prevention
  • Internal administration and analysis
  • Improving our services

We conduct Legitimate Interest Assessments to ensure our interests don't override your rights.

Legal Obligations (Article 6(1)(c))

  • Tax and accounting requirements
  • Anti-money laundering compliance
  • Regulatory reporting
  • Court orders and legal proceedings

Consent (Article 6(1)(a))

  • Marketing to prospects
  • Newsletter subscriptions
  • Cookie placement (non-essential)
  • Special category data processing

3.2 Categories of Data We Process

Professional Information:

  • Name, job title, company
  • Business contact details
  • Professional background
  • Areas of expertise

Communication Data:

  • Email correspondence
  • Meeting notes
  • Consultation records
  • Feedback and evaluations

Technical Data:

  • IP addresses
  • Browser information
  • Device identifiers
  • Usage analytics

Financial Data:

  • Billing information
  • Payment records
  • Tax identifiers
  • Transaction history

3.3 Data Sources

  • Directly from you
  • Your employer (for B2B services)
  • Public professional profiles (LinkedIn)
  • Business information databases
  • Website interactions

4. DATA RETENTION

We retain personal data only as long as necessary:

Data Category Retention Period Basis
Client project data 7 years after project completion Tax and legal requirements
Marketing contacts Until opt-out + 3 years Legitimate interests
Employee data 7 years post-employment Labor law requirements
Financial records 7 years Estonian accounting law
Website analytics 14 months Performance analysis
Security logs 6 months Security and compliance
Cookies See Cookie Policy Varies by type

After retention periods expire, data is securely deleted or anonymized.

5. DATA SECURITY

5.1 Technical Measures

  • AES-256 encryption for data at rest
  • TLS 1.3 for data in transit
  • Multi-factor authentication
  • Regular security updates and patches
  • Intrusion detection systems
  • Regular penetration testing

5.2 Organizational Measures

  • Access control on need-to-know basis
  • Confidentiality agreements for all staff
  • Regular security training
  • Incident response procedures
  • Vendor security assessments
  • Data protection by design and default

5.3 Breach Response

If a breach occurs:

  • We notify authorities within 72 hours (if required)
  • We inform affected individuals of high-risk breaches
  • We document all breaches internally
  • We implement measures to prevent recurrence

6. HOW TO EXERCISE YOUR RIGHTS

6.1 Making a Request

Contact Methods:

  • Via Email: privacy@hobotnika.com
  • Via Post: Narva mnt 5, 10117 Tallinn, Estonia
  • Via Phone: +351 933679097 (verification required)

Required Information:

  • Your full name and contact details
  • Specific right(s) you're exercising
  • Information to locate your data
  • Preferred response format

6.2 Response Timeline

  • Acknowledgment: Within 5 business days
  • Response: Within 30 days
  • Complex requests: Up to 2 additional months (with notification)
  • Excessive requests: May charge reasonable fee or refuse

6.3 Complaints

If you're unsatisfied with our response:

First: Contact our Privacy Team for resolution

Second: File a complaint with:

Estonian Data Protection Inspectorate

Tatari 39, 10134 Tallinn, Estonia

Email: info@aki.ee

Phone: +372 627 4135

Website: www.aki.ee

Your Local Authority:

You may also complain to your local supervisory authority.

Contact Us

For all privacy-related matters:

Hobotnika OÜ

Data Protection Team

Email: privacy@hobotnika.com

Phone: +351 933679097

Address: Narva mnt 5, 10117 Tallinn, Estonia

Registry Code: 16770728

Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 9:00-17:00 EET

Supervisory Authority:

Andmekaitse Inspektsioon

Tatari 39, 10134 Tallinn, Estonia

info@aki.ee | www.aki.ee

© 2025 Hobotnika OÜ. All rights reserved.

); }

client/src/pages/PrivacyPage.tsx.content:
export default function PrivacyPage() { return (

Privacy Policy

HOBOTNIKA OÜ

Effective Date: January 1, 2025

Last Updated: January 1, 2025

1. Introduction and controller information

Hobotnika OÜ ("we," "us," or "our") is committed to protecting your personal information and respecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and protect information when you visit our website, use our business consulting services, or interact with us through any channel.

Data Controller Details:

Hobotnika OÜ

Registry Code: 16770728

Address: Narva mnt 5, 10117 Tallinn, Estonia

Email: info@hobotnika.com

Phone: +351 933679097

Estonian Data Protection Contact:

Email: privacy@hobotnika.com

Phone: +351 933679097

2. Scope and application

This Privacy Policy applies to all personal data we process in our capacity as a data controller, including:

  • Information collected through our website and online forms
  • Data processed in connection with our business consulting services
  • Information gathered through professional business development activities
  • Data collected through website analytics for business improvement
  • Information managed in our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems

This policy applies regardless of your location, though additional rights may apply based on your jurisdiction.

3. Information we collect

3.1 Information You Provide Directly

When you request a consultation or engage our services, we collect:

  • Contact Information: Name, job title, company name, business email address, phone number
  • Business Information: Company details, industry sector, business challenges, project requirements
  • Communication Data: Content of emails, messages, and other communications with us
  • Financial Information: Billing address, payment details (processed securely by our payment processors)

3.2 Information Collected Automatically

When you visit our website, we automatically collect:

  • Device and Browser Data: IP address (anonymized for EU visitors), browser type, operating system, device identifiers
  • Usage Information: Pages visited, time spent on pages, clicks, referring website, exit pages
  • Location Data: Country and region (derived from anonymized IP address)
  • Analytics Data: Website interaction patterns for business improvement purposes

3.3 Information from Third Parties

We may receive information about you from:

  • Business Partners: Referrals and introductions from professional networks
  • Public Sources: Publicly available business directories and professional profiles
  • Professional Networks: LinkedIn and similar professional platforms (publicly available information only)

4. Legal bases for processing

We process your personal data based on the following legal grounds:

4.1 Contract Performance (GDPR Article 6(1)(b))

Processing necessary to provide our consulting services, including:

  • Responding to consultation requests
  • Delivering consulting services
  • Managing client relationships
  • Processing payments and invoices

4.2 Legitimate Interests (GDPR Article 6(1)(f))

We process data based on our legitimate business interests, including:

  • Professional business development to relevant prospects
  • Improving our services and website functionality
  • Ensuring network and information security
  • Preventing fraud and maintaining service quality
  • Internal business analytics and performance analysis

We have conducted legitimate interest assessments to ensure our interests do not override your rights and freedoms.

4.3 Consent (GDPR Article 6(1)(a))

With your explicit consent for:

  • Professional communications where not based on legitimate interest
  • Non-essential website analytics
  • Sharing data with specific business partners

4.4 Legal Obligations (GDPR Article 6(1)(c))

To comply with:

  • Tax and accounting requirements
  • Anti-money laundering regulations
  • Court orders and legal proceedings
  • Regulatory reporting obligations

5. How we use your information

5.1 Service Delivery

  • Providing business consulting services
  • Managing client engagements and projects
  • Communicating about service delivery
  • Processing payments and maintaining accounts

5.2 Business Development

  • Sending relevant information about our consulting services
  • Professional relationship management
  • Industry analysis and business intelligence
  • Understanding our market and service effectiveness

5.3 Website and Technology Operations

  • Operating and improving our website
  • Analyzing website usage and performance for business purposes
  • Ensuring security and preventing fraud
  • Providing customer support

5.4 Legal and Compliance

  • Complying with legal obligations
  • Defending legal claims
  • Maintaining business records
  • Conducting internal audits

6. Website analytics and tracking technologies

6.1 Google Analytics

We use Google Analytics to understand how visitors use our website so we can improve it and our marketing efforts.

6.2 Google Services for Our Business

We may use Google services for our business operations, including:

  • Google Ads to advertise our company's services
  • Google Workspace for email and document management
  • Other Google APIs for internal business purposes

6.3 Managing Your Preferences

You can control tracking through:

  • Our cookie consent banner
  • Browser settings to refuse cookies
  • Google Analytics Opt-out: tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout

7. Data sharing and third parties

7.1 Categories of Recipients

We share personal data with:

Service Providers (Data Processors)

  • Cloud storage and hosting services
  • Email and communication platforms
  • Payment processors
  • Website analytics providers (Google Analytics for business purposes only)
  • Customer relationship management systems

Professional Advisors

  • Legal counsel
  • Accountants and auditors
  • Business consultants

Business Partners (Limited Sharing)

  • Strategic consulting partners (with your consent)
  • Referral partners (introduction purposes only)
  • Joint service delivery partners (as joint controllers)

Legal and Regulatory

  • Government authorities when required by law
  • Courts and law enforcement
  • Regulatory bodies

7.2 International Data Transfers

As an Estonian company serving global clients, we transfer data internationally:

From Americas to Estonia (EU)

  • Transfers from the US rely on Standard Contractual Clauses or EU-US Data Privacy Framework
  • Transfers from Canada benefit from partial adequacy decision for PIPEDA-covered data
  • Transfers from Latin America use Standard Contractual Clauses with supplementary measures

From Estonia to Third Countries

  • We ensure appropriate safeguards through adequacy decisions, SCCs, or specific derogations
  • Transfer impact assessments conducted for high-risk jurisdictions
  • Technical and organizational measures implemented to protect data during transfer

8. Your privacy rights

8.1 Rights Under GDPR (EU/UK Residents)

You have the right to:

  • Access your personal data and receive a copy
  • Rectification of inaccurate or incomplete data
  • Erasure ("right to be forgotten") under certain circumstances
  • Restrict processing in specific situations
  • Data Portability to receive data in a structured format
  • Object to processing based on legitimate interests or direct marketing
  • Withdraw Consent at any time where processing is based on consent
  • Not be subject to solely automated decision-making

8.2 Rights Under CCPA/CPRA (California Residents)

You have the right to:

  • Know what personal information we collect, use, share
  • Access your personal information (twice annually free of charge)
  • Delete your personal information (with certain exceptions)
  • Correct inaccurate personal information
  • Non-Discrimination for exercising privacy rights

Important: We do not sell or share personal information for cross-context behavioral advertising.

8.3 Rights Under PIPEDA (Canadian Residents)

You have the right to:

  • Access personal information we hold about you
  • Correct inaccuracies in your information
  • Withdraw Consent for certain processing activities
  • File a Complaint with the Office of the Privacy Commissioner

8.4 Rights Under LGPD (Brazilian Residents)

You have the right to:

  • Confirmation of processing and access to data
  • Correction of incomplete or inaccurate data
  • Anonymization, blocking, or deletion of unnecessary data
  • Portability to another service provider
  • Information about sharing with third parties
  • Revocation of consent

8.5 Exercising Your Rights

To exercise any of these rights, contact us at privacy@hobotnika.com. We will respond within the timeframes required by applicable law (generally within 30 days). We may request information to verify your identity before processing your request.

9. Data retention

We retain personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this policy:

Data Type Retention Period
Client Data Duration of engagement plus 7-10 years for legal and professional requirements
Consultation Requests 3 years from last meaningful contact
Business Contacts 3 years from last interaction, with annual review
Financial Records 7 years for tax and accounting obligations
Website Analytics 14 months maximum
Legal Claims Until expiration of applicable limitation periods

We regularly review and securely delete data that is no longer required.

10. Data security

We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data, including:

Technical Measures:

  • Encryption of data in transit (TLS 1.3) and at rest (AES-256)
  • Multi-factor authentication for system access
  • Regular security assessments and penetration testing
  • Intrusion detection and prevention systems
  • Secure backup and disaster recovery procedures

Organizational Measures:

  • Staff training on data protection and security
  • Access controls and role-based permissions
  • Confidentiality agreements with all personnel
  • Vendor due diligence and contractual protections
  • Incident response and breach notification procedures

11. Data breach notification

In the event of a personal data breach, we will:

  • Notify the Estonian Data Protection Inspectorate within 72 hours (if required)
  • Inform affected individuals without undue delay if the breach poses high risk to rights and freedoms
  • Document all breaches and maintain records for regulatory compliance
  • Implement measures to prevent future incidents

For US residents, we comply with applicable state breach notification laws.

12. Children's privacy

Our services are intended for businesses and professionals. We do not knowingly collect personal data from individuals under 16 years of age (13 in Estonia for information society services). If we become aware of such collection, we will promptly delete the information.

13. Third-party links

Our website may contain links to third-party sites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these external sites. We encourage you to review their privacy policies before providing any personal information.

14. Updates to this policy

We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of material changes by:

  • Posting a notice on our website
  • Sending an email to registered users
  • Obtaining consent where legally required

The "Last Updated" date at the top indicates the most recent revision.

15. Contact information and complaints

15.1 Contact Us

For questions about this Privacy Policy or our privacy practices:

Email: privacy@hobotnika.com

Phone: +351 933679097

Mail: Hobotnika OÜ, Narva mnt 5, 10117 Tallinn, Estonia

15.2 Supervisory Authorities

You have the right to lodge a complaint with a data protection authority:

Estonian Data Protection Inspectorate

Tatari 39, 10134 Tallinn, Estonia

Email: info@aki.ee

Phone: +372 627 4135

Website: www.aki.ee

For Other Jurisdictions:

  • EU/UK: Your local data protection authority
  • California: California Privacy Protection Agency (cppa.ca.gov)
  • Canada: Office of the Privacy Commissioner (priv.gc.ca)
  • Brazil: Autoridade Nacional de Proteção de Dados (gov.br/anpd)

16. International users

For users outside the EU, we aim to provide similar privacy protections. Contact privacy@hobotnika.com for any privacy-related requests.

17. Business communications

By requesting consultation or providing business contact information, you consent to receive information about our consulting services. All communications are for informational purposes only and do not constitute guarantees of results. You may opt-out at any time by:

  • Clicking the unsubscribe link in our emails
  • Emailing privacy@hobotnika.com
  • Calling +351 933679097

For B2B communications to business contacts, we may also rely on legitimate interests where permitted by law.

18. Data protection contact

While not legally required to appoint a Data Protection Officer, we have designated a privacy contact to handle data protection matters:

Privacy Contact

Email: privacy@hobotnika.com

Phone: +351 933679097

Language Availability: This Privacy Policy is available in Estonian upon request. Please contact privacy@hobotnika.com for the Estonian version.

Accessibility: If you require this Privacy Policy in an alternative format for accessibility reasons, please contact us.

© 2025 Hobotnika OÜ. All rights reserved.

); }

client/src/pages/TermsPage.tsx.content:
export default function TermsPage() { return (

Terms of Service

HOBOTNIKA OÜ PROFESSIONAL CONSULTING SERVICES

Effective Date: January 1, 2025

Last Updated: January 1, 2025

These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern the provision of professional business consulting services by Hobotnika OÜ, a company registered in Estonia (registry code: 16770728) with its registered office at Narva mnt 5, 10117 Tallinn, Estonia ("Hobotnika," "we," "us," or "our") to our clients ("Client," "you," or "your").

1. ACCEPTANCE OF TERMS

1.1 Agreement Formation.

By engaging our services, requesting a consultation, or executing a Statement of Work, you agree to be bound by these Terms. These Terms, together with any applicable Statement of Work ("SOW"), constitute the entire agreement between the parties.

1.2 Authority to Bind.

You represent and warrant that you have full corporate power and authority to enter into these Terms and that the person accepting these Terms on behalf of Client is authorized to bind Client.

1.3 Language.

These Terms are provided in English and Estonian. In case of discrepancy, the English version shall prevail for international clients unless otherwise agreed in writing.

2. SERVICES

2.1 Scope of Services.

Hobotnika provides professional business consulting services including strategic planning, business development, process optimization, digital strategy, market analysis, and operational consulting as detailed in each SOW.

2.2 Service Delivery.

Services will be performed with professional competence and in accordance with applicable industry standards.

2.3 Project Management.

Each engagement will be governed by a SOW specifying:

  • Deliverables and success criteria
  • Timeline and milestones
  • Project team composition
  • Acceptance procedures
  • Change management process

2.4 Client Cooperation.

Client shall provide timely access to personnel, information, systems, and facilities reasonably required for service delivery. Delays in providing such cooperation may impact project timelines and costs.

3. PAYMENT TERMS

3.1 Fees.

Client shall pay fees as specified in the applicable SOW. Unless otherwise specified, all fees are quoted in EUR and exclude applicable taxes.

3.2 Payment Schedule.

Invoices are issued monthly in arrears or upon milestone completion as specified in the SOW. Payment is due within thirty (30) days of invoice date.

3.3 Expenses.

Reasonable travel and out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with the services will be billed at cost with prior approval for expenses exceeding EUR 500.

3.4 Late Payment.

Overdue amounts bear interest at the rate of 0.8% per month or the maximum rate permitted by Estonian law, whichever is lower. We reserve the right to suspend services for accounts more than sixty (60) days overdue.

3.5 Taxes.

Client is responsible for all taxes, duties, and assessments associated with the services, excluding taxes based on Hobotnika's net income. For EU clients, reverse charge mechanism applies for VAT.

4. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

4.1 Client Materials.

Client retains all rights to materials, data, and information provided to Hobotnika. We are granted a limited license to use Client materials solely for service delivery.

4.2 Deliverables.

Upon full payment, Client owns all rights to deliverables specifically created for Client under the SOW. This excludes Hobotnika's pre-existing intellectual property and methodologies.

4.3 Hobotnika Property.

We retain all rights to our pre-existing intellectual property, methodologies, know-how, tools, and techniques. Client receives a non-exclusive, perpetual license to use such materials solely in connection with the deliverables.

4.4 Feedback.

Any suggestions, feedback, or improvements provided by Client may be used by Hobotnika without restriction or compensation.

4.5 Residual Knowledge.

Hobotnika may use general knowledge, skills, and experience gained during the engagement, provided no Client confidential information is disclosed.

5. CONFIDENTIALITY

5.1 Confidential Information.

Each party shall maintain the confidentiality of the other party's confidential information with the same degree of care used to protect its own confidential information, but no less than reasonable care.

5.2 Exceptions.

Confidentiality obligations do not apply to information that:

  • Is or becomes publicly available through no breach
  • Was rightfully known before disclosure
  • Is independently developed without use of confidential information
  • Must be disclosed by law or court order (with prompt notice to the disclosing party)

5.3 Duration.

Confidentiality obligations survive termination of these Terms for five (5) years, except for trade secrets which remain protected indefinitely.

5.4 Return of Materials.

Upon termination or request, each party shall return or destroy all confidential information of the other party, except as required for legal or compliance purposes.

6. LIABILITY AND DISCLAIMERS

6.1 Nature of Services.

Services are advisory only. Client retains full responsibility for all business decisions, implementations, and outcomes. Hobotnika provides recommendations based on available information but makes no guarantees regarding results.

6.2 No Warranties.

HOBOTNIKA PROVIDES SERVICES "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.

6.3 Exclusion of Damages.

IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, LOST PROFITS, OR LOST BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES, REGARDLESS OF THE THEORY OF LIABILITY.

6.4 Client Acknowledgment and Assumption of Risk.

Client acknowledges and agrees that:

  • All business decisions remain solely with Client
  • Client will independently evaluate all recommendations
  • Implementation of any advice is at Client's sole discretion and risk
  • Hobotnika's role is limited to providing information and analysis
  • Client has adequate expertise or will obtain independent verification before acting on recommendations

6.5 Client Indemnification.

Client shall indemnify and hold Hobotnika harmless from any claims, damages, losses, or expenses arising from:

  • Client's use or implementation of recommendations
  • Client's business operations or decisions
  • Third-party claims related to Client's business
  • Client-provided materials or information

6.6 Force Majeure.

Neither party is liable for delays or failures due to causes beyond reasonable control, including acts of God, pandemics, government actions, terrorism, or infrastructure failures. The affected party must promptly notify the other party and use reasonable efforts to mitigate impacts.

7. DATA PROTECTION AND API USAGE

7.1 GDPR Compliance.

Both parties shall comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and applicable data protection laws. When processing personal data, parties act as independent controllers unless otherwise specified in a Data Processing Agreement.

7.2 Security Measures.

Hobotnika implements appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data, including encryption, access controls, and regular security assessments.

7.3 International Transfers.

Any transfer of personal data outside the EEA will be subject to appropriate safeguards including Standard Contractual Clauses or adequacy decisions.

7.4 Data Breach.

In case of a personal data breach, the affected party shall notify the other party without undue delay and cooperate in any required notifications to supervisory authorities or data subjects.

7.5 Third-Party API Usage.

Hobotnika may use third-party APIs (including Google APIs) for legitimate business purposes, limited to:

  • Our website analytics for business improvement
  • Internal business intelligence and performance analysis
  • Our own business marketing and advertising campaigns
  • Internal marketing performance analysis and optimization

7.6 API Data Restrictions.

Data accessed through third-party APIs will not be used for:

  • Accessing or managing client advertising accounts
  • Providing advertising services to clients
  • Data sales or monetization beyond company's services
  • Building advertising profiles for third parties

We do not use APIs to access, manage, or operate any client accounts or systems.

8. TERM AND TERMINATION

8.1 Term.

These Terms commence upon acceptance and continue until terminated. Individual SOWs may specify their own terms.

8.2 Termination for Convenience.

Either party may terminate an SOW upon thirty (30) days written notice. Client shall pay for all services performed and expenses incurred through the termination date.

8.3 Termination for Cause.

Either party may terminate immediately upon written notice if the other party:

  • Materially breaches and fails to cure within fifteen (15) days of notice
  • Becomes insolvent or subject to bankruptcy proceedings
  • Engages in illegal or unethical conduct

8.4 Survival.

Provisions relating to payment, confidentiality, intellectual property, liability, and dispute resolution survive termination.

9. PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS

9.1 Compliance.

Hobotnika operates in compliance with Estonian law, EU regulations, and international consulting standards including adherence to professional ethics codes.

9.2 Conflicts of Interest.

Hobotnika will disclose any actual or potential conflicts of interest. We maintain policies to identify and manage conflicts appropriately.

9.3 Anti-Corruption.

Both parties shall comply with applicable anti-corruption laws including the Estonian Penal Code and UK Bribery Act where applicable.

9.4 Independent Contractor.

Hobotnika is an independent contractor. Nothing in these Terms creates an employment, agency, or partnership relationship.

10. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

10.1 Governing Law.

These Terms are governed by Estonian law, excluding conflict of law provisions.

10.2 Negotiation.

Parties shall first attempt to resolve disputes through good faith negotiation between senior executives.

10.3 Arbitration.

Disputes not resolved within thirty (30) days shall be finally settled by arbitration under the Rules of the Arbitration Court of the Estonian Chamber of Commerce and Industry. The tribunal shall consist of one arbitrator, proceedings shall be in English, and the seat shall be Tallinn, Estonia.

10.4 Injunctive Relief.

Either party may seek injunctive relief in courts of competent jurisdiction for breaches of confidentiality or intellectual property provisions.

10.5 Attorneys' Fees.

The prevailing party in any dispute is entitled to recover reasonable attorneys' fees and costs.

11. GENERAL PROVISIONS

11.1 Amendments.

These Terms may only be modified in writing signed by both parties.

11.2 Assignment.

Neither party may assign these Terms without prior written consent, except in connection with a merger or acquisition.

11.3 Severability.

If any provision is found unenforceable, the remainder continues in full effect.

11.4 Notices.

All notices must be in writing and delivered by email with confirmation or registered mail to the addresses specified in the SOW.

11.5 No Waiver.

Failure to enforce any provision does not constitute a waiver of that provision.

11.6 Entire Agreement.

These Terms and applicable SOWs constitute the entire agreement, superseding all prior agreements and understandings.

Contact Information

Hobotnika OÜ

Email: privacy@hobotnika.com

Address: Narva mnt 5, 10117 Tallinn, Estonia

Phone: +351 933679097

Registry Code: 16770728

{/* Estonian Version */}

Teenuse Tingimused

HOBOTNIKA OÜ PROFESSIONAALSED KONSULTATSIOONITEENUSED

Jõustumise kuupäev: 1. jaanuar 2025

Viimati uuendatud: 1. jaanuar 2025

Need teenuse tingimused ("Tingimused") reguleerivad Hobotnika OÜ professionaalseid ärikonsultatsiooniteenuseid. Hobotnika OÜ on Eestis registreeritud ettevõte (registrikood: 16770728), mille registreeritud asukoht on Narva mnt 5, 10117 Tallinn, Eesti ("Hobotnika," "meie," või "meile") klientidele ("Klient," "teie," või "teile").

1. TINGIMUSTE VASTUVÕTMINE

1.1 Lepingu sõlmimine.

Meie teenuste kasutamisel, konsultatsiooni taotlemisel või töölehe allkirjastamisel nõustute nende tingimustega. Need tingimused koos mis tahes kohaldatava töölehtega ("TL") moodustavad poolte vahelise täieliku kokkuleppe.

1.2 Volitused.

Te kinnitahte ja garanteerite, et teil on täielik korporatiivne võim ja volitused nende tingimuste sõlmimiseks ning et isik, kes võtab need tingimused kliendi nimel vastu, on volitatud klienti siduma.

1.3 Keel.

Need tingimused on esitatud inglise ja eesti keeles. Vastuolude korral kehtib rahvusvaheliste klientide puhul ingliskeelne versioon, kui pole kirjalikult kokku lepitud teisiti.

2. TEENUSED

2.1 Teenuste ulatus.

Hobotnika osutab professionaalseid ärikonsultatsiooniteenuseid, sealhulgas strateegilist planeerimist, ärendust, protsesside optimeerimist, digitaalstrateegiat, turu-uuringuid ja tegevuskonsultatsioone vastavalt igale TL-le.

2.2 Teenuste osutamine.

Teenused osutatakse professionaalse pädevuse ja kohaldatavate tööstusharu standarditega kooskõlas.

2.3 Projektijuhtimine.

Iga koostööd reguleerib TL, mis täpsustab:

  • Tulemused ja edu kriteeriumid
  • Ajakava ja verstapostid
  • Projekti meeskonna koosseis
  • Vastuvõtu protseduurid
  • Muudatuste juhtimise protsess

2.4 Kliendi koostöö.

Klient peab õigeaegselt tagama juurdepääsu personalile, teabele, süsteemidele ja ruumidele, mis on teenuste osutamiseks mõistlikult vajalikud. Sellise koostöö pakkumise viivitused võivad mõjutada projekti ajakavasid ja kulusid.

3. MAKSETINGIMUSED

3.1 Tasud.

Klient maksab tasusid vastavalt kohaldatavale TL-le. Kui pole määratud teisiti, on kõik tasud noteeritud eurodes ja ei sisalda kohaldatavaid makse.

3.2 Maksegraafik.

Arved esitatakse igakuiselt tagasiulatuvalt või verstapostituse lõpetamisel vastavalt TL-s määratule. Makse tuleb tasuda kolmekümne (30) päeva jooksul arve kuupäevast.

3.3 Kulud.

Mõistlikud reisi- ja taskukulud, mis on teenustega seoses tekkinud, arvestatakse omahinnaga, kui kulud ületavad 500 eurot, on vaja eelnevat heakskiitu.

3.4 Hiline makse.

Tähtaja ületanud summadelt võetakse intressi 0,8% kuus või Eesti seadusega lubatud maksimaalne määr, olenevalt sellest, kumb on väiksem. Jätame endale õiguse peatada teenused kontode puhul, mis on üle kuuekümne (60) päeva tähtaja ületanud.

3.5 Maksud.

Klient vastutab kõigi teenustega seotud maksude, tollimaksude ja hindamiste eest, välja arvatud Hobotnika netosissetulekul põhinevad maksud. EL-i klientide puhul kehtib käibemaksu puhul pöördmaksustamise mehhanism.

4. INTELLEKTUAALOMAND

4.1 Kliendi materjalid.

Klient säilitab kõik õigused Hobotnikale esitatud materjalidele, andmetele ja teabele. Meile antakse piiratud litsents kasutada kliendi materjale ainult teenuste osutamiseks.

4.2 Tulemused.

Täieliku tasumise järel omab klient kõiki õigusi TL alusel spetsiaalselt kliendi jaoks loodud tulemustes. See ei sisalda Hobotnika olemasolevat intellektuaalomandit ja metoodikat.

4.3 Hobotnika omand.

Säilitame kõik õigused oma olemasolevale intellektuaalomandile, metoodikale, teadmistele, tööriistadele ja tehnikatele. Klient saab mitte-ainuõiguslik, püsiva litsentsi kasutada selliseid materjale ainult tulemustega seoses.

4.4 Tagasiside.

Kliendi poolt esitatud ettepanekuid, tagasisidet või parendusi võib Hobotnika kasutada ilma piirangute või hüvitiseta.

4.5 Jääteadmised.

Hobotnika võib kasutada koostöö käigus omandatud üldisi teadmisi, oskusi ja kogemusi, tingimusel et kliendi konfidentsiaalset teavet ei avaldata.

5. KONFIDENTSIAALSUS

5.1 Konfidentsiaalteave.

Iga pool säilitab teise poole konfidentsiaalteabe konfidentsiaalsuse sama hoolsusega, mida kasutatakse oma konfidentsiaalteabe kaitsmiseks, kuid mitte vähem kui mõistliku hoolsusega.

5.2 Erandid.

Konfidentsiaalsuskohustused ei kehti teabe kohta, mis:

  • On või muutub avalikult kättesaadavaks ilma rikkumiseta
  • Oli õiguspäraselt teada enne avalikustamist
  • Arendatakse iseseisvalt ilma konfidentsiaalteabe kasutamiseta
  • Tuleb avalikustada seaduse või kohtu korraldusega (koos kiire teatamisega avaldavale poolele)

5.3 Kestus.

Konfidentsiaalsuskohustused jäävad kehtima nende tingimuste lõpetamise järel viis (5) aastat, välja arvatud ärisaladused, mis jäävad igaveseks kaitstud.

5.4 Materjalide tagastamine.

Lõpetamisel või taotlusel tagastab või hävitab iga pool teise poole kogu konfidentsiaalteabe, välja arvatud juriidiliste või vastavusnõuete jaoks vajalik.

6. VASTUTUS JA LAHTIÜTLEMISED

6.1 Teenuste olemus.

Teenused on ainult nõuandvad. Klient säilitab täieliku vastutuse kõigi äri otsuste, rakendamiste ja tulemuste eest. Hobotnika annab soovitusi olemasoleva teabe põhjal, kuid ei anna garantiid tulemuste kohta.

6.2 Garantiide puudumine.

HOBOTNIKA OSUTAB TEENUSEID "NAGU ON" ILMA IGASUGUSTE GARANTIIDETA, VÄLJENDATUD VÕI KAUDSED, SEALHULGAS KAUBANDUSLIKUD GARANTIID, SOBIVUS KINDLAKS OTSTARBEKS VÕI MITTE-RIKKUMINE.

6.3 Kahju välistamine.

ÜKSKI POOL EI VASTUTA KAUDSETE, JUHUSLIKE, JÄRGNEVATE, ERILIKE VÕI KARISTUSLIKE KAHJUDE, KASUMI KAOTUSE VÕI ÄRIVÕIMALUSTE KAOTUSE EEST, OLENEMATA VASTUTUSE TEOORIAST.

6.4 Kliendi tunnustamine ja riski võtmine.

Klient tunnistab ja nõustub, et:

  • Kõik äri otsused jäävad ainult kliendi vastutuseks
  • Klient hindab kõiki soovitusi iseseisvalt
  • Mis tahes nõuannete rakendamine on kliendi ainuvastutusel ja riisikol
  • Hobotnika roll piirdub teabe ja analüüsi pakkumisega
  • Kliendil on piisav ekspertiis või ta saab iseseisva kontrollimise enne soovituste järgi tegutsemist

6.5 Kliendi hüvitamine.

Klient hüvitab ja hoiab Hobotnikat kahju eest kolmandate osapoolte nõuete puhul, mis tulenevad:

  • Kliendi soovituste kasutamisest või rakendamisest
  • Kliendi äri tegevusest või otsustest
  • Kolmandate osapoolte nõuetest seoses kliendi äriga
  • Kliendi poolt esitatud materjalidest või teabest

6.6 Vääramatu jõud.

Ükski pool ei vastuta viivituste või ebaõnnestumiste eest, mis tulenevad mõistliku kontrolli alt väljaspool olevatest põhjustest, sealhulgas Jumala teod, pandeemiad, valitsuse tegevused, terrorism või taristu tõrked. Mõjutatud pool peab teist poolt kiiresti teavitama ja kasutama mõistlikke jõupingutusi mõjude leevendamiseks.

7. ANDMEKAITSE JA API KASUTAMINE

7.1 GDPR nõuete täitmine.

Mõlemad pooled peavad täitma Üldist Andmekaitse Määrust (EL) 2016/679 ja kohaldatavaid andmekaitse seadusi. Isikuandmete töötlemisel tegutsevad pooled sõltumatute vastutavate töötlejatena, kui pole andmetöötluslepingus määratud teisiti.

7.2 Turvaabinõud.

Hobotnika rakendab sobivaid tehnilisi ja organisatsioonilisi meetmeid isikuandmete kaitsmiseks, sealhulgas krüpteering, juurdepääsu kontroll ja regulaarsed turvaanalüüsid.

7.3 Rahvusvahelised ülekanded.

Mis tahes isikuandmete ülekanne väljaspool EMP-d allub sobivate kaitsemeetmetega, sealhulgas standardsed lepingu tingimused või adekvaatsuse otsused.

7.4 Andmekaitse rikkumine.

Isikuandmete rikkumise korral teavitab mõjutatud pool teist poolt viivitamatult ja teeb koostööd vajalike teatamistes järelevalveasutustele või andmesubjektidele.

7.5 Kolmandate osapoolte API kasutamine.

Hobotnika võib kasutada kolmandate osapoolte API-sid (sealhulgas Google API-d) õiguspärasteks äri eesmärkideks, piirdudes:

  • Meie veebisaidi analüütikaga äri parandamiseks
  • Sisemine äri luure ja tulemuslikkuse analüüs
  • Meie enda äri turundus ja reklaamikampaaniad
  • Sisemine turunduse tulemuslikkuse analüüs ja optimeerimine

7.6 API andmete piirangud.

Kolmandate osapoolte API-de kaudu kätte saadud andmeid ei kasutata:

  • Kliendi reklaamikontode ligipääsemiseks või haldamiseks
  • Reklaamiteenuste osutamiseks klientidele
  • Andmete müük või rahaksimuutmine peale ettevõtte teenuste
  • Reklaamiprofiilide loomine kolmandate osapoolte jaoks

Me ei kasuta API-sid kliendi kontode või süsteemide ligipääsemiseks, haldamiseks või käitamiseks.
